dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool uses the GeoPyPython package in order to conduct a reverse geocode using the various geocoding APIs.

Installing GeoPy

Note: If using the Google service, as a free user, you are limited to 2500 queries a day at a rate of 5 queries per second.

See https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/usage-limits

tool.name: AddressLookup

param.name: inFeature
param.dialogReference: The POINT or POLYGON feature class with coordinates to search.
param.pythonReference: A DEFeatureClass specifying the POINT or POLYGON feature class with coordinates to search.

param.name: addressExists
param.dialogReference:
Specify if the address field exists in the attribute table.

Checked - The address field exists.

Unchecked - The address field does not exist. A new field called "Address" will be created. This is the DEFAULT.
param.pythonReference: A boolean specifying whether or not an address field exists. If not a field named "Adddress" will be created. Default is False.

param.name: addressField
param.dialogReference: The field that is used to store address values.
param.pythonReference: A GPString specifying the field name of the attribute in which returned addresses are stored.

param.name: service
param.dialogReference: The service used to search for addresses.
param.pythonReference: A GPString specifying which geocoding service should be used. Valid values are Google and OpenStreetMap.

tool.summary:
This tool uses the GeoPyPython package in order to conduct a reverse geocode using the various geocoding APIs.

Installing GeoPy

Note: If using the Google service, as a free user, you are limited to 2500 queries a day at a rate of 5 queries per second.

See https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/usage-limits
tool.usage:
This tool uses various geocoding APIs to find a feature's adddress using it its lat/lon coordinates.

The address is populated to an existing or newly created field in the Street, City, State, Zip format.
